orchestrator.goal: Integrate the action schemata and the two scenarios to produce a single PDDL domain for actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted, plus two grounded PDDL problem files (one per scenario) that are ready to be solved with the FastDownward planner.

public_information: You can perform six actions over objects: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted.
Action paltry x y z requires hand x, cats y, texture z, vase x y, and next y z. It adds next x z and deletes vase x y.
Action sip x y z requires hand x, cats y, texture z, next x z, and next y z. It adds vase x y and deletes next x z.
Action clip x y z requires hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, and next x z. It adds vase x y and deletes next x z.
Action wretched x y z w requires sneeze x, texture y, texture z, stupendous w, next x y, collect y w, and collect z w. It adds next x z and deletes next x y.
Action memory x y z requires cats x, spring y, spring z, and next x y. It adds next x z and deletes next x y.
Action tightfisted x y z requires hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, and vase x y. It adds next x z and deletes vase x y.
Scenario one goal: next object_11 object_9.
Scenario two goal: next object_12 object_11.
This is a deterministic STRIPS-like planning world; actions have add and delete effects.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a planning analyst. Given public action schemata and private scenario details, extract the relevant objects, normalize the initial facts and goal, and validate or repair the proposed plan. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a concise JSON object with keys: objects (list), init (list of grounded atoms), goal (single grounded atom), proposed_plan (list of action strings as given), validated_plan (list of actions that actually achieve the goal under the schemata, minimal if possible), and notes (short diagnostics about preconditions not met, added or removed steps).
analyze.prompt: Your name is scenario_one. Use the following public action schemata and world notes: {environment->public_information} Your private information includes initial facts, a goal, and a proposed plan: {agents->scenario_one->private_information} Your objective: analyze feasibility and produce a validated plan in the specified JSON schema. If the proposed plan is invalid or suboptimal, fix it and explain why in notes. Keep to grounded atoms using only the provided objects.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a planning analyst. Given public action schemata and private scenario details, ground the problem by identifying the objects, normalize the initial facts and goal, and synthesize a valid plan. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a concise JSON object with keys: objects (list), init (list of grounded atoms), goal (single grounded atom), proposed_plan (empty if none provided), validated_plan (a sound plan that achieves the goal), and notes (short rationale).
analyze.prompt: Your name is scenario_two. Use the following public action schemata and world notes: {environment->public_information} Your private information includes initial facts and a goal: {agents->scenario_two->private_information} Your objective: produce a valid plan that achieves the goal in the specified JSON schema. Keep to grounded atoms using only the provided objects.

synthesize_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert planning engineer. Integrate the action schemata with the two scenario analyses to produce a single PDDL domain and two PDDL problem files (one for scenario one and one for scenario two). The domain must capture actions paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted with their exact preconditions and effects. The problems must include the complete object set, normalized init facts, and the respective goal. Target the FastDownward planner: ensure STRIPS-compatible syntax, avoid advanced features, and use untyped objects for maximum compatibility. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain>. Enclose each problem between <problem id='s1'></problem> and <problem id='s2'></problem>.
synthesize_pddl.prompt: Integrate the following resources to produce the final PDDL artifacts compatible with FastDownward: Public action schemata and world notes: {environment->public_information} Scenario one analysis: {analysis_s1} Scenario two analysis: {analysis_s2} Requirements: 1) Provide one PDDL domain that defines predicates and the six actions with add and delete effects exactly as described. 2) Provide two PDDL problem files, one per scenario, naming them problem-s1 and problem-s2 inside their respective problem tags. 3) Use the same object set in both problems as listed in the analyses (union is acceptable). 4) Ensure the syntax is parsable by FastDownward. 5) Include minimal comments only if helpful.
